intro: Apium meoides, commonly known as wild celery, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves that emit a mild, spicy aroma. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Apium meoides is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
